import React from 'react'; export const AmazingWorldOfVi = () => { let imgUrl = require('../../../assets/images/amazingWorldOfVim.png'); return (

Welcome

to

Why Vi/m?

Vi or Vim (Vi imporved) is a text editor that can be found almost on every unix/linux based machine.

If you connect to a dishwasher you can be almost certain that Vi or Vim will be available on that machine.

Therefor it is of GREAT importance to know how to use this mythical and mysterious text editor.

First things first.

To open Vi or Vim simply type vi end hit the return button and Vi or Vim will be in action. To open a file

for editing with Vi or Vim simply type vi followed_by_your_filename. Don't worry if the file does not exist

Vi or Vim will kindly create it for you.

Second things first???

To open Vi or Vim is of course a heavenly feeling, but however one needs to know how to quit Vi or Vim

otherwise one will be stuck in Vi or Vim heaven for ever.

To quit Vi or Vim when opened in your terminal simply do the following:

  1. Hit the ESC key
  2. Type the following :q!
  3. Hit the RETURN key

And you will acsend from Vi or Vim heaven, however the acsention is without saving the file you are editing.

To ascend from Vi or Vim heaven, with saveing your file on the the way down simply do the following:

  1. Hit the ESC key
  2. Type the following :x or :wq
  3. Hit the RETURN key

Good stuff to know and have navigating Vi or Vim heaven.

Remeber Vi or Vim has two modes:

  1. The command mode
  2. The insert mode

In the command mode, user can move around the file, delete text, etc. In the insert mode, user can insert text.

To navigate your coursor in Vi or Vim simply use the arrow keys.

IF the arrow keys are not present one can navigate by:

  1. Hit the ESC key
    • h key: moves the coursor to the left
    • j key: moves the coursor downwards
    • k key: moves the coursor upwards
    • l key: moves the coursor to the right
) }
